title: Neuropathic Pain Scale (NPS)
description: Quantifies severity of neuropathic pain using 10 specific pain quality dimensions. Only for patients already diagnosed with neuropathic pain.

parameters.name: intensity
parameters.unit: points (0 = no pain, 10 = most pain imaginable)

parameters.name: sharp
parameters.description: How sharp is the pain? ('Like a knife')
parameters.unit: points (0 = no pain, 10 = most pain imaginable)

parameters.name: hot
parameters.description: How hot is the pain? ('On fire')
parameters.unit: points (0 = no pain, 10 = most pain imaginable)

parameters.name: dull
parameters.unit: points (0 = no pain, 10 = most pain imaginable)

parameters.name: cold
parameters.unit: points (0 = no pain, 10 = most pain imaginable)

parameters.name: sensitive
parameters.description: How sensitive is the skin to light touch? ('Raw skin')
parameters.unit: points (0 = no pain, 10 = most pain imaginable)

parameters.name: itchy
parameters.unit: points (0 = no pain, 10 = most pain imaginable)

parameters.name: unpleasant
parameters.unit: points (0 = no pain, 10 = most pain imaginable)

parameters.name: deep_pain
parameters.description: If the pain is deep, how intense is the deep pain?
parameters.unit: points (0 = no pain, 10 = most pain imaginable)

parameters.name: surface_pain
parameters.description: If the pain is on the surface, how intense is the surface pain?
parameters.unit: points (0 = no pain, 10 = most pain imaginable)

ranges.interpretation: Score indicates mild neuropathic pain symptoms. Consider monitoring and conservative management strategies.
Score indicates moderate neuropathic pain symptoms. May benefit from multimodal pain management approach.
Score indicates severe neuropathic pain symptoms. Comprehensive pain management strategy recommended.
Score indicates very severe neuropathic pain symptoms. Urgent comprehensive pain management intervention may be needed.

references: Galer BS, Jensen MP. Development and preliminary validation of a pain measure specific to neuropathic pain: the Neuropathic Pain Scale. Neurology. 1997 Feb;48(2):332-8. doi: 10.1212/wnl.48.2.332.
formula: Total Score = Sum of all 10 item scores (each scored 0-10)
notes: Only for patients already diagnosed with neuropathic pain - not a diagnostic tool
Useful for assessing pain severity and monitoring treatment response
Each item scored 0-10 where 0 = no pain and 10 = most pain imaginable
Higher scores indicate worse neuropathic pain
